subject: Creativity
title: How Songs Get Stuck: The Science of Earworms
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Songs Get Stuck: The Science of Earworms usable.

hook.text: Baby Shark, Twinkle Star, Bohemian Rhapsody â€” some songs loop in your head for hours. Your brain has been hijacked.

buildup.text: Earworms (involuntary musical imagery) affect 98% of people.

discovery.text: Research shows earworm songs share features: a common melodic contour with one unusual interval that grabs attention.

twist.text: The auditory cortex replays the song on a loop, trying to 'complete' it.

climax.text: Hit songwriters exploit this deliberately. Max Martin (Backstreet Boys, Taylor Swift) engineers melodic hooks designed.

punchline.text: Earworms aren't accidental. The catchiest songs are neuroscience experiments.

quiz.question: What musical features make a song more likely to become an earworm?
options: Simple melody with one unexpected interval
